snippet: The British government is headed for a bruising showdown presaging what some clerics called the most serious rift between church and state in centuries.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron's contentious plan to legalize same-sex marriage provokes the ire of the country's Anglican and Roman Catholic Church leaders, presaging what some call the most serious rift between church and state in centuries; proposal also threatens to provoke further divisions in Cameron's conservative party.
lead_paragraph: The British government is headed for a bruising showdown presaging what some clerics called the most serious rift between church and state in centuries.

headline.seo: Churches Challenge Britain Over Same-Sex Marriage
headline.main: Churches Challenge British Government Over Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: Gay Marriage Creating Rift In Britain

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
